repnme.cdata!:
China - Third Ozone Depleting Substances
            Phase Out Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Third Ozone Depleting
            Substances (ODS) Phase Out Project for China were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to global
            environment outcome was low or negligible, the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower performance
            was also satisfactory.  There are six main lessons learned
            from the project: (a) the lack of an adequate policy and
            regulatory framework made the transition away from ODS into
            substitutes more difficult and prolonged; (b) the lack of
            public awareness of the ODS phase-out objective during early
            project years also made the transition away from ODS into
            substitutes more difficult; (c) the project will have
            benefited from increased involvement of provincial and local
            governments; (d) the way in which project beneficiaries and
            enterprises were selected was too mechanical; (e) the
            process of technology transfer is not completely under the
            control of the project and therefore introduces
            uncertainties; and (f) the quality and continuity of key
            personnel benefited the project immensely.

5077683.trustfund:
TF022002-OTF-CHINA ODS III,TF020738-OTF: CHINA-ADV VIII THIRD
            MONTREAL PROTOCOL ODS PHASEOUT PROJ.,TF022452-OTF:CHINA ODS III PPA IX

repnme.cdata!:
China - Third Montreal Protocol Ozone
            Depleting Substances Phase Out Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Third Montreal
            Protocol Ozone Depleting (ODS) Substances Phase Out Project
            are to: 1) support China's total ODS phaseout program
            by establishing an efficient and flexible institutional
            mechanism to prepare, appraise, finance and implement a
            large number of subprojects; 2) implement cost-effective
            priority subprojects; and 3) allow ODS phaseout to proceed
            at or ahead of current schedule. The project will support 60
            to 80 subprojects in all ODS user and producer industries.
            The subprojects will provide: 1) technical and financial
            assistance to enterprises for technology transfer, design,
            training and implementation; 2) assistance in closing
            Chlorofluorocarbons (CFC) production and halon plants; and
            3) technical assistance to the National Environmental
            Protection Agency (NEPA) and the financial agents in project
            development and implementation.

docna.cdata!:
China - Third Montreal Protocol Ozone
            Depleting Substances Phase Out Project

China - Third Montreal Protocol
